data.title: What a fun place!
data.text: After visiting the state capitol and the Kansas Museum of History, we wanted a relaxed attraction and stumbled on this gem.  It is a collection of restored historic buildings that gives the visitor a chance to step back into the past and experience life as it was over 100 years ago.  We had a guide that took us through all the buildings and provided extensive insight and history about each one.  Enjoyed a old-time soda at the restored general store soda fountain.  If you have a group of 12 or more, inquire ahead of time about the opportunity to enjoy a meal prepared on the restored log cabin prepared over the open-hearth fireplace just as it would have been done by your great-great-grandmother.  This is a DON"T MISS!!

data.title: Old Prairie Town
data.text: Worth a quick look around the old properties that have moved to this location. It's a pretty and very tidy outdoor museum. The botanical gardens are right next to it.

data.title: Roses
data.text:
This park is unusual as it is an entertainment complex . A great walking park with ponds a national class rose garden. A carousel. , a regional class zoo, and a very capable playhouse make it a regional class destination.

people's entertainment complex . There is the park

data.title: Step into Topeka' past
data.text: Ward Meade Park is a beautiful oasis in central Topeka.  From a summer day with a green river soda for yesteryear served up from the period soda fountain, to Apple Fest where kids can see a black smith at work or make rope.  The gardens are a beautiful setting for weddings

data.title: Tranquility in my neighborhood.
data.text: I have been visiting this place for over 30 years and always find it enjoyable. I even shot some video for my memory tools which turned out great except for the highway noise which is close but unseen.

data.title: Full of history plus beautiful gardens
data.text: Took my granddaughter here as it is one of my favorite local spots. We both took lots of photos and enjoyed the collection of old structures. I told her stories of the pioneers and of my ancestors. A definite must see when in Topeka.

data.title: Back in time
data.text: This park isa really nice place to relax and enjoy the beautiful gardens. The park also has some very nicebuildingsthat will take you back in time. This park is a must visit.

data.title: Oasis in the city
data.text: Warde Meade is an oasis in downtown Topeka! The gardens are beautiful as are the historic buildings. They offer many classes and events. Weddings are performed in the garden.

data.title: Very interesting and educational place to visit.
data.text: Enjoyed seeing the different buildings, including a mansion, old soda fountain, dental office, grocery store, telephone office, train depot, etc.  Interesting for kids that love history and adults.

data.title: Step back in time
data.text: Walk the grounds of Old Prairie Town on your own or go with a guide and see inside all the buildings, learn the history, and tour the Ward Meade home.  Shop in the General Store and visit the Drug Store for refreshments. You will be amazed at the flower and water gardens as you leisurely stroll the winding paths of Old Prairie Town. Come for Tulip Time in March-April each year to see thousands of tulips in bloom and come again the first Sunday in October for the Apple Festival. You will enjoy all the food, entertainment, apple cider, and shopping at the many vendor booths, but don't leave without having a slice of apple pie!

data.title: A small park with lots of history
data.text: Along with the original Ward-Meade house there are a number of historical buildings from KS that have been moved onto the site, including an old fashioned soda fountain, blacksmith shop, log cabin from the days of the original settlers, barber shop, general store, church, school, RR station.... the gardens are wonderful to walk through.  There are several festival type events held in the park every year.

data.title: Take the guided tour
data.text: I learn something more/new every time I take a tour.  Ask questions, visit the soda fountain, book a group dinner in the cabin or the main house  :)

data.title: Historical Buildings and Beautiful Gardens
data.text: We visited this historic site in Topeka during Tulip Time.  The gardens are beautiful and well maintained.  The buildings are interesting inside and out.  It was a fun visit.  The ladies in the buildings shared some really interesting information.  You can even get a snack in the old drug store.

data.title: Beautiful place, historic
data.text: There is an old cabin you can go through. The town is set up like an old fashioned town. There is a train. The old Ward Meade home is set up like a museum for viewing. It's just lovely. The grounds are beautiful.

data.title: Nice Garden, Friendly people
data.text: Enjoyed walking through the garden and drinking a great chocolate malt.  We enjoyed looking at the different buildings.

data.title: Beautiful grounds and historic features
data.text: Ward meade park won't disappoint it has lovely grounds I love to visit in the spring when the tulips are blooming they have festivals there check their website for when. There are lots of historic buildings and a fun soda fountain.

data.title: Take a visit back in time
data.text: to  My kids love to go here, from age 19 to 8.  They have been coming here with their grandma for many many years.  There are so many different things to see and an Old Ice Cream Shoppe they have to stop at each time.

data.title: Beautiful and unique
data.text:
I’ve been here a few times by myself and for events. It’s a unique little park that’s always fun to come to. It very well maintained and fun to explorer and look around. The “old prairie town” portion of the park is great for photo ops and putting an educational spin on things.

The trails (or actual park) portion make for a very nice walk. The garden is amazing and you can easily get “lost” down all the trails. Most if not all of the trails are concrete/stone paths and are easily accessible by anyone.

data.title: Great venue for a holiday dinner
data.text: This was our third annual dinner during the Christmas season. The historic home and grounds are a wonderful place to start the holidays. Great volunteer staff and food is catered by a local business. Nice finishing touch after the dinner to be able to tour the historic buildings and have some cookies in the log cabin as well as a chocolate sundae in the drug store.

data.title: Nice Family Venue
data.text: Nice historical stores and exhibits when functioning during summer hours.  Well worth dropping in if during summer.
